results.title: Dad's tools
results.creator_credit: Fred Atwell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: There is a lot to do after a bushfire but Fred Atwell wants more than anything to find his dad’s cherished homemade tools. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Tomorrow and yesterday
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”
The Japanese are well known for their ancient civilisation with its tradition and brilliant festivals as well as its high technology and future-oriented attitudes. This film shows how the two meet.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: South west cinemas
results.brief_description: Take a front-seat tour of three regional Victorian cinemas, the Capitol in Warrnambool, the Lorne Theatre and the Portland Star. Your tour guides are the cinema staff, old and new, and the locals who frequent these historic cinemas and keep them alive. Despite highlighting the struggle to function commercially in the light of increased access through DVDs and downloadable films, the stories told, both colourful and romantic hint that the local cinema still has a place in people’s lives and how difficult it can be to replace the simple joy of the shared cinematic experience.

results.title: The Portland Star
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Local residents and theatre workers talk about the positive impact the Portland Star has made on their lives and reminisce about “rolling Jaffas down the aisle”. Even though the theatre has seen changes over the years, in 2008 offering live music as a means to keep going, the proprietor expresses his passion for the cinema, even when it sometimes runs at a loss, and why he will continue to serve the community with great movies and live events.

results.title: Top Screen 2006
results.brief_description:
Compile of 14 short films selected as the VCE Top Screen Season of Excellence 2006.
Two of the short films included in the compile are not licensed and therefore not available for screening:
“Blue sky, green grass, white clouds” and “Bad business”.

results.title: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007. Weeks of preparation and anticipation helped lessen the devastation but in no way eliminated the horror and heartache of living through a time when not only livelihood is in the hands of mother nature, but lives.
results.title_for_label: From the ashes: stories from the Gippsland Bushfires 06-07 : Digital Storytelling project
results.description: Ten locals from the East Gippsland region in south-eastern Victoria tell their stories of survival during the fierce bushfires that swept the area in the summer of 2006-2007.
